title: Good Top Laner
body:
Hey Guys,
Im fairly new to LoL (level 7) and i am looking for a good top laner. I have taken a liking towards{{champion:11}}  but i feel I need to explore my boundaries. I bought Jax as reccommended by a friend but i really do not understand how to use him. Riven and Yasuo are interesting picks but i need something to cover my needs in the short-term.
Thanks

replies.body:
Garen would be one of my top picks.
Aatrox would also be a handy champion.
Yorick, Illaoi, and Darius are good top laners as well.
Since you are new to League of Legends, I suggest you try Darius, Garen, Aatrox, Fiora,  Irelia, Jax, Jarvan IV.
I would not recommend you to try Riven or Yasuo at this stage, they are both difficult to use champions. Riven is easier to use than Yasuo, but you may find that she's not easy to master.

If you need any help, reply to the message, add me in game, I have plenty of tips to share!
Also, if you're interested in Yasuo, I'm a Yasuo main :)

Basically, figure out your play style, what champs you want to play then buy them. 
Someof the easier top laners at the moment are tyndamere (top lane carry), Malphite (top lane tank), Renekton (lane bully) or if you can hit skill shots maybe ryze (ap hyper carry). Finding the style of champ you want to play is the most important thing
Hmm I was contemplating Nasus.....any further info?

im guessing darius is always banned.

I would recommend:

Tryndamere (has potential to win basically anyone)
Renekton (good tank, good top)
Irelia (best team fights)
Gnar (broken)

I wouldn't recommend the likes of Jax, even though his awesome, I dunno, never see him win top, even likes of trynd, and just sucks in team fights, good pusher however.

Olaf is one of the best solo queue top laners in the game... 
1. strong early game (not Riven lvl 1-9 strong) but still strong. 
2. snowballs incredibly hard
3. unkillable with his ultimate as it removes all disables/CC for 4-6 seconds - provided you stay sustained and go for a bruiser build items (black cleaver, randumins, etc)
4. can shove the wave with q forcing the enemy laner to last hit under tower (not a terrible tactic in lower elos where people can't last hit) 
5. dive their backline with your ultimate, particularly good against immobile champions (Ashe, Lux, Rengar) 
6. as mentioned earlier he can shove the wave fast and be a split push menace, his ult will allow you to escape the enemy jungler, etc. typically you will run ghost so you can hunt down enemy squishies even more effectively... in combination with your ultimate. 

the biggest problems olafs have is feeding pre6 and going for duels they will lose... if for example your enemy laner went back and had a pickaxe or longsword or health crystal, etc... they will beat you in a 1v1 at that time.. you could bait them into forcing them to fight you but have your jungler waiting and get a free kill
